Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water, showing the environment details like trees, water, and ground features.
The student can depict a variety of living things in each habitat, including plants and animals such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can illustrate the different types of plants in each habitat, showing differences and similarities across the two locations.
The student can illustrate the different types of animals in each habitat, showing differences and similarities across the two locations.
The student can label the drawings to indicate key features or living things, helping to identify patterns in the diversity of life.
The student can show how data about plants and animals were collected, such as by adding notes or symbols to represent observations from media or real life.
